results.title: The Boy and the pelican
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Gurnan, Arden Winch and Wessex Film Productions
results.brief_description: Pedro a pampered pelican lives happily on a Greek island until the arrival of a small boy called Hiko. Pedro is then forgotten by the islanders. He tries to fly away but is too bloated to succeed. On his return Pedro is seen by Niko who falls in love with him. Pedro is now completely happy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Gurnan, Arden Winch and Wessex Film Productions

results.title: The Borders: where Scotland and England meet
results.creator_credit: Mike Pavett, Robin Crichton and Edinburgh Film Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the agricultural and industrial development of the border regions of Scotland and England, and the growth of new houses and educational institutions. Highlights projects which have been implemented to attract population and encourage young people to stay instead of seeking careers and employment elsewhere.

results.title: Inland with McDouall Stuart
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Men of stamina”.
The first part of the film tells the story of Stuart’s three attempts, the last successful, to cross the continent from south to north. The second part describes today in the Northern Territory. A description of the country Stuart opened up suggesting that his prophecies are coming true.

results.title: The Blue mountains crossing - 1813
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Men of stamina”.
Takes the students from the original great journal of exploration by Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson through to the present day development deriving from that exploration. No other credits available.

results.title: The Big green disc
results.creator_credit: Charlie Hemming, Phillip Nash and Media Design Interactive
results.brief_description: An interactive documentary, this CD-ROM looks at the future of our planet through a discussion of the environmental issues threatening it and what every person can do to help. Problems investigated include; global warming, pollution, ozone layer depletion, acid rain and the potential solutions: recycling, alternative energy sources and conservation. After examining the issues, you can enter into the debate, hearing what the world’s experts have to say about the issues affecting us all. This beautifully composed CD-ROM is fully narrated with stunning photography throughout, it includes specially filmed video sequences, in-depth photo stories and animated diagrams, including graphs to illustrate relevant points. Also included is a full index of contact addresses for all the relevant environmental organisations in Europe and America. A very useful and interesting means of learning how we can all help to save our home, which would suit secondary school aged children and adults alike!

results.title: The Bicyclist
results.creator_credit: Nordisk Film Junior and Kobenhavns Politi
results.brief_description: A safety education film presented from the point of view of a red bicycle, owned first by a boy who obeyed the traffic rules and then by one who brought himself and the bicycle to a sad fate. The first boy is seen riding sensibly on the road and passing a police cycling test. The bicycle is then stolen by a lad whose reckless riding leads to a serious accident to himself and the bicycle falling into the river to rust. The film brings out a number of specific points about safe and dangerous cycling.

results.title: The Bergen International Festival
results.brief_description: Describes the international cultural festival held in Bergen, Norway each year. The festival, attended by people from all over the world, is dedicated to the memory of Edvard Grieg. Outdoor theatre, philharmonic orchestras, folk dancing displays, ballet, singing and painting are some of the attractions. Concerts are held in historic buildings all over the town. Birgit Nilsson sings and finally the Bergen Harmonia plays Grieg’s Concerto in A Minor.
